trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of custom Web Parts verbs.
This class cannot be inherited.
Web Parts verbs are interactive user interface (UI) elements that are displayed in a menu or title bar of a Web Parts control.
A Web Parts zone provides to a Web Parts control a standard set of verbs that are rendered in the Web Parts verb menu.
A custom Web Parts zone or a Web Parts control can add additional verbs to this menu.
ASP.NET provides several standard verbs by default to all controls in a Web Parts zone, including the close and minimize verbs.
There are standard verbs for opening, closing, editing, and minimizing a control, and other verbs for exporting a definition for the control or loading a Help file.
You can create new verbs that are added to the Web Parts verb menu.

A control can inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> base class and add <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerb> objects to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> collection.
This collection can then be added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.Verbs%2A> collection of the control.
A control can also implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebActionable> interface and override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebActionable.Verbs%2A> property.
You can then use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> collection to add custom verbs to a control.
This class implements <xref:System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase>, which provides a non-generic, read-only collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection"></xref> class.
This constructor creates an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> object.

To create a new instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> using an existing collection of Web Parts verbs, you can use <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection.%23ctor%28System.Collections.ICollection%29>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection"></xref> class using the specified collection.
This constructor creates an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> using the specified verbs collection.
This collection can be any object derived from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains a set of Web Parts verbs.
An object derived from <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> that contains a set of Web Parts verbs.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection"></xref> class using the specified collections.
This constructor can be used to combine two Web Parts verb collections.
An existing <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection"></xref>.
An object derived from <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> that contains a set of Web Parts verbs.
Searches the Web Parts verb collection for the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerb"></xref> object.
For more information on using this method, see its base method, <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.System%23Collections%23IList%23Contains%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerb"></xref> to be found.
`true` if the collection contains the Web Parts verb; otherwise, `false`.
Copies elements of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified index.
For more information on using this method, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The array that elements are to be copied to.
The index where copying should begin.
Specifies an empty collection that you can use instead of creating a new one.
This static field is read-only.

A static, read-only, empty instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection> reduces memory usage in cases where you want an empty collection instance to return the proper object type from a method or to compare the instance with another object, but you do not need to add members to the instance.
Searches for the specified Web Parts verb and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire collection.
For more information on using this method, see <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.System%23Collections%23IList%23IndexOf%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerb"></xref> to be located.
The index of the Web Parts verb.
Gets a Web Parts verb from the collection at the specified index.
Use this property to get a Web Parts verb if you know the index of the verb in the collection.

You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection.Contains%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartVerbCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to locate a particular verb in the collection.
The index value of the Web Parts verb to be retrieved.
A Web Parts verb from the collection.
